description: Please read...
Thank you for joining us...
Looking to buy, sell or trade a pack of cards? Look no further, this is the place for you! But remember, "Caveat emptor"-let the buyer beware.

sub_forum_name: My Side Of The Screen - by Steve Brooks
description: Thoughts and views on magic, the internet, and anything else that's on my mind.
Come here to discuss the articles, gossip, satire and humor found inside this controversial periodical. All other subject matter is subject to removal.
Café rules & etiquette, Posting guidelines, Magic transactions, Secret sessions, Avatars, Icons and How to make a post.

Are you a southpaw? This forum is dedicated to us left-handed folks who practice magic in a right-handed world. Share tips, ideas and suggestions for performing and learning magic the left-handed way (which has its own unique challenges).

sub_forum_name: A Hundreth Pleasant Conceipts - by Curtis Kam
description: Adventures in advanced coinmanship.

sub_forum_name: 'Nothing But The Truth' by Craig Petty
description: A sporadically posted video show voicing personal commentary on the magic community at large. The show also includes reviews of tricks, books, videos, downloads, lectures and conventions. This is the official forum to discuss the various episodes. Any off topic discussions will be removed with no explanation given. Enter at your own risk...
Featuring concept, design, performance, and theory in the world of illusion.

sub_forum_name: THE MAGIC MENU - The International Journal for Close-Up Magicians
description: Topics and discussions pertaining to the contents of the Magic Menu magazine. All other subject matter will be deleted.
Theories, thoughts, observations, opinions and reviews on myriad magical subjects.
A cover to cover look...

The Essential Magic Conference is the world’s first web conference for magicians. 33 speakers spread over 3 days of conference streamed live worldwide! This forum is for discussions relating to the EMC only - All other content will be removed.

sub_forum_name: Taco Tuesday For Magicians with Luke Dancy (Watch LIVE every Tuesday night at 8:30pm EST!)
description: Get your weekly dose of magic news, a detailed look at the best handpicked magic tricks and your chance to win FREE MAGIC just for tuning in. Join the fun live each week on the All Things Magic YouTube channel and Facebook page. Catch the replay from each week's show right here!

sub_forum_name: MAGICSEEN - Britain's brightest independent magic magazine
description: This area provided for topics and discussions pertaining to the contents of magicseen magazine. All off topic material will be deleted.

sub_forum_name: The Magic Newswire by Dodd Vickers
description: The Original Magic News & Information Portal On The Internet now has its very own discussion forum here on the Café. Do you have a question for Dodd, this is the place to post it. This area is for Magic Newswire topics only, all other material will be removed. Look inside for all the details!

sub_forum_name: Do you see what I see?
description: Serious discussions on the theatrical art and performance of pantomime, mimicry and general mime. Topics include history, inspiration and technique.
My take on the newest titles...
Discussions pertaining to the tricks and articles which appear between the covers of this magical tome. Off-topic postings will be removed.

sub_forum_name: The Return Of The (not so) Youthful Curmudgeon! - by Paul Chosse
description: Comments on the magic scene, past, present, and future. Plus: Close-up magic with just about anything. How-to, how not to, and why. In either case, you ought to bother...

This forum dedicated to discussions surrounding the SansMinds magic company and its unique line of magical creations. Topics may include history, collections, tricks, video's, etc. If you are a SansMinds fan then this is the forum for you!
The exploration and discussion centering around Urban Legends. All other subject matter (e.g, frauds, hoaxes, etc) will be removed.

sub_forum_name: Notes from a Designer's Logbook - by George Ledo
description: Thoughts, ideas, and essays on imagination, creativity, prop design, and stagecraft... along with some techniques from the wonderful world of theater.

This forum reserved for discussions surrounding the Tenyo Elite line of magic tricks which are produced by JPS Magic Studios Ltd. Which tricks will be produced? What are your personal favorites? Tenyo fans rejoice!

sub_forum_name: Enhancing Your Ability to Work Wonders - by Brad Burt
description: Essays on the Art and Craft of Being a Magician

sub_forum_name: From The Wizards Cave - by Bill Palmer
description: Our resident curmudgeon applies his wizardly wiles to work out problems in everything from ethics to history to indigestion.
I.B.M. Youth! This forum is for the discussion of topics involving the I.B.M. Youth. Posts may include questions about joining, events, etc. Remember, I.B.M. Youth subject matter only.

sub_forum_name: Rectangles and pentagons and squares, oh my!
description: This forum is for the discussion of the ancient art of Origami. Originating in Japan, the art and science of folding paper into shapes and its relationship with mathematics is a fascinating study.
Topics and discussions relating to the pages of this electronic magazine. All other subject matter will be removed.
Check here for news and information concerning the Café.

MINDvention is THE annual mentalism convention held in Las Vegas open to anyone interested in mystery entertainment and mentalism. This forum is dedicated to discussions related to the MINDvention convention - all other content will be removed.

sub_forum_name: The Shift: Picks of the Week by Chris Ramsay
description: The Shift is a mash-up of product testing, sessioning and whatever else there is to do! Chris Ramsay delivers not only an in depth opinion on his two picks of the week but tests them out on the streets! He'll also bring you guys along for any conventions, jams or lectures that he attends! Look Inside!

sub_forum_name: The Society of American Magicians Youth
description: The Society of American Magicians Youth! This forum is for the discussion of topics involving the S.A.M.Y. Posts may include questions about joining, events, etc. Remember, S.A.M.Y. subject matter only.
Discussions on the use of assistants in our shows, be they on the payroll or taken from the audience. This area is also the place where professional assistants may gather to discuss the craft.
In your show, or in a drawer?
This forum dedicated to the discussion of bar bets, tricks, stunts and other silly wagers.

This forum provided as a place where folks can discuss the latest rumors, read announcements and speculate about the obvious hyperbole surrounding many of the upcoming APP products that are being released for the Apple iPhone, iPad, iTouch and various Android based devices. Will they be useful for real magicians or just a novelty best left for the layperson?

Magic and science working side by side. What are the possibilities? Discussions may also include how scientific principles have fooled the uneducated since the dawn of time. How have times changed, if at all? This is the forum for such topics.
This area is specifically for reviews of APPS for the Apple iPhone, iPad, iTouch and various Android based devices. Remember, reviews only. All other subject matter will be removed.
Thinking about creating your own deck? This forum is for you! Serious discussions on playing card design, crowd funding, printing sources, marketing, etc.
Discussions on the importance of practice and rehearsal, and the difference between the two. Topics may include discipline, and advice or tips on forming good working habits in this important area.

sub_forum_name: Magic Friday by Jamie D. Grant
description: Every Friday a trick is taken out into the real world and performed under test conditions. Join Jamie, Angry Bob and all the rest as we learn which tricks really work and which ones just don't live up to all the hype. Look inside for full details!
This forum is for topics and discussions related to the history and origins of various sleights, moves, and handlings.
This forum is for specific discussions surrounding various Time Periods and Character Based Magic performing.
Discussions pertaining to the art and practice of theatrical pickpocketing and the classic watch steal.
Discussions on the use and properties of optical illusions, and how these lines and drawings fool the eye.
Reminisce about the dealers from days gone by and the products or advice they once offered, or perhaps just fond memories of those Saturday afternoons you spent hanging out in their shops.

General discussions on the history of playing cards, preservation, care and maintenance & storing of your prized decks. This is also the place to talk about your collection & share photos with the community.
This forum provided for discussions and topics regarding the latest happenings, articles, etc. which appear within the pages of MAGIC magazine. All off-topic matter will be deleted.

Serious discussions surrounding the problems and/or advantages of performing magic as a woman. For example, clothing issues with pulls, topits, holdouts, etc. Ladies, this area is provided especially for you!

What do you look for when shopping for magic? What criteria do you use when deciding which dealer receives your hard earned cash, and why some may never hear from you again? This forum is NOT to discuss specific dealers, but rather the things they do that make you glad, or make you mad. Voice your ideas and thoughts here.

sub_forum_name: REEL MAGIC MAGAZINE - TV For Magicians
description: Topics and discussions surrounding this DVD based magic magazine. All off-topic matter will be removed with no explanation given.

This forum is for discussing the history and practice of Volunteering to perform for various groups for free (e.g, hospitals, nursing homes, fundraisers, etc). This is especially useful for beginners or those wanting to try out new material.
Magic routines presented in story form

This forum provided as a place where you can discuss the latest rumors, read announcements and speculate about the obvious hyperbole surrounding many of the upcoming decks that are being released into the card community. Will they indeed be the next Federal 52 or something of the dollar store variety?
This area reserved for posts which deal in the specialty arena of tricks and effects using jumbo or miniature playing cards.
You have an idea you feel is commercial, now what do you do? Where do you sell it? How much do you ask? This forum is for the general discussion of magic publishing.
Serious discussions and topics regarding the latest content found within the pages of GENII magazine. All other subject matter will be removed.

Interested in magic competition? Here is the place to post discussions on possible strategies, what to expect, how to prepare, what to wear. Topics may include news and views on upcoming contests, etc.
This area for the review of large stage size illusions (e.g, Zig-Zag, Sawing, Origami, Mis-made Girl, Levitation, etc).

sub_forum_name: The Magic Word by Scott Wells
description: Thru your host Scott Wells you will enjoy seeing the sights, watching the videos, and listen to podcasts with magicians talking about their magic, magic conventions and what's going on in the magic scene today. Look inside for full details!

Discussions on the art and practice of being a clown. Topics include history, make-up, costumes, funny props, face painting and more. This is also the area to discuss general circus life, history, lingo, etc.

sub_forum_name: The Association of Family and Kidshow Performers
description: This forum is for the discussion of topics involving KIDabra International. Posts may include questions about joining, chapter meetings, lectures, conference information and the like. Remember, KIDabra subject matter only.
This area dedicated to discussions on the history and origins of magic literature, including books, manuscripts, monographs, magazines and the like.

Are you a fan of the Wizard Magic Review? If so, you'll be happy to know that this is the official forum to discuss all the things that are reviewed on the show. Remember, only Wizard magic Review material, anything else will be removed. Look inside for all the details!
This area is to discuss ideas for Patter and the use of Scripts in our magical presentations.

This forum is for the discussion of topics involving the C.A.M. Posts may include questions about joining, club meetings, lectures, convention information and the like. Remember, C.A.M. subject matter only.
A place to tell stories and experiences from shows, tours or performances you have done. No questions, advice, or theories...just stories!
The art and practice of the pitch. Discussions and topics on selling the Wondermouse, Svengali decks, fuzzy worms, steak knifes, candy, etc.

sub_forum_name: If right you win, if wrong you lose...
description: Serious discussions on Three Card Monte, Fast and Loose, The Shell Game and other such scams.
Discussions on the history and origins of tricks & effects, props, apparatus, gimmicks and the like.

This forum is for the discussion of topics involving the FCM. Posts may include questions about joining, club meetings, lectures, convention information and the like. Remember, FCM subject matter only.
Topics covering performing on television, video, film, radio, and other media.
Discussions on proper attire, and how your wardrobe may affect the way in which your audience perceives you. Topics may include types of dress, be it formal wear, contemporary, retro, etc.
Often, out of the blue, you are requested to perform. Are you prepared? What do you do? This area is to discuss the keen art of 'Impromptu' and 'Improvisational' magic.
Discussions on the use of magic effects that rely on properties of arithmetic for success. Topics may also include magic squares and the like.
This area reserved for the discussion of APPS for the Apple iPhone, iPad, iTouch and various Android based devices. All other subject matter will be removed.
Look here to learn about the latest products, contests and special offers that our Cafe sponsors are offering inside!

This forum is for the discussion of topics involving the S.A.M. Posts may include questions about joining, club meetings, lectures, convention information and the like. Remember, S.A.M. subject matter only.

Thoughts and discussions pertaining to the generally accepted rules and standards of conduct as it relates to members of the magic industry who create, manufacture or publish. This forum is all about Ethics.
Are you creative? This is the place to post ideas on presentation plots, no matter how silly, ridiculous, preposterous, or mundane. Remember, presentations-not methods.
You take card flourishes seriously? Are you really into XCM? Do you see yourself as part of the Cardistry crowd? Then this is the forum for you!

This forum is strictly for the review of playing cards, card clips & other playing card related items. Is it a great product or simply more of the same? You decide. Any off topic material will be removed.

Do you know of someone in the art who could use some words of encouragement right now? Perhaps they are ill, or have just lost a loved one? This is the forum to let our magic family at The Café help out.
Discussion on magic collecting (posters,autographs,old props,etc)
General discussions on juggling, diabolo, devil sticks, yo-yo, unicycle, poi, meteors and the fine art of contact juggling.
This forum created for the discussion of tricks and effects which are pretty much self-working or extremely easy to do. (e.g, no sleights, semi-automatic, no skill).
General discussions on prop management
This area dedicated to topics on puzzles that challenge the mind, be they Chinese boxes, blocks, metal and wire, discs, or even the famous Rubik's Cube.
This area for discussions of tricks and effects using paper currency.(Misled, $100 Bill switch, Bill tube, etc)
General discussion on rope magic

This forum is for the discussion of topics involving the I.B.M. Posts may include questions about joining, club meetings, lectures, convention information and the like. Remember, I.B.M. subject matter only.
This forum dedicated specifically to the discussion of magicians from our magical past, including such greats as Robert-Houdin, Houdini, Blackstone, Thurston, Carter, Marlo, Vernon and others.
This area is specifically for the review of mentalism related items. This can include props, Dvds, books, monographs, pamphlets, manuscripts, notes, eBooks, PDF's and downloads.
This area is for reviews of magical accessories such as wands, cases, topits, playing cards, etc. only.
If you love to play with fire...Remember, this forum is for discussions on routines and possible presentational ideas for effects with fire - NOT methods or recipes for fuel mixtures.
This is the forum to discuss the art and practice of using stacks and other special arrangements of the pasteboards. Topics may include the use of marked cards and memorized deck work.
Topics and discussions centering around tricks which do not use an entire deck of cards (e.g, a packet trick, torn & restored, card warp, etc).

This forum dedicated to discussions surrounding the Tenyo Magic company and its unique line of magical products. Topics may include history, collections, tricks, etc. If you are a Tenyo fan then this is the forum for you!
Planning your vacation and want to catch a little magic along the way? Look inside! This is the area to announce show schedules, so other members will know who is playing where!
This forum dedicated to balloons and ballooning. Topics include technique, sculpture basics, types of balloons, etc.
Serious discussions on the art and practice of Hypnosis.
Performing random acts of magic for a total stranger...
General discussion on comedy magic
General discussion of magic with silks and handkerchiefs. Topics may include the caring of silks, folding, dyeing, etc.
Discussions on ventriloquism and the art of making and using puppets. Topics include vent techniques, voice training, types of  dolls, using marionettes, Punch & Judy,  story scripting and more!
Topics on the art of gospel magic.

sub_forum_name: I want to see the manager!
description: Do you have an idea or suggestion for our menu? Or just a question? Post it here
General discussions concerning the stars of magic. Topics may include reviews or commentary on tv specials, personal appearances, tour schedules, radio interviews, etc.

History, theory and ideas surrounding the mysterious world of the unscrupulous gambler. Topics may include card cheating, card counters, advantage players, etc.  Strategies, theories and schemes for winning at Poker, BlackJack, Slots, Roulette, Craps and other casino games.
General discussion on using and caring for doves, rabbits, parrots and other livestock.
Discussions on the use of lights, music, sound, fog, backdrops, etc.
This area for reviews of Ebooks, PDF's or Downloads exclusively.
Discussions on the latest news, gossip and rumors in the magic community.
General discussion concerning magic on the internet

sub_forum_name: The Magic Café Tech Help Area
description: Are you having technical issues with the forums? If so, explain your situation or ask your questions here.

Discussions of life on the midway - fire walking, eating glass, blockhead, bed of nails and other side-show stuff. Topics may include carnival history, games, lingo, grindshows, flea circus', exhibits, etc.
General discussion covering escape magic. Topics include ropes,chains,boxes,handcuffs,strait jackets,etc.
Topics on billiard balls, thimbles, pipes, cigars or cigarettes, candles, dancing canes, card productions, zombie and more!
Discussions on the serious art of busking.

This forum dedicated to discussions pertaining to the use of gimmicked or specialty packs (e.g, Invisible deck, Stripper, Svengali, Mirage, Split, etc). Topics may also include custom printed cards (e.g, Double face, 31/2 clubs, clear cards and other odd varieties).
Discussions of tricks or effects which seemingly use ordinary filthy lucre, but do not ( Scotch & Soda, Coin in bottle, etc )
Topics on living room type magic (tricky bottles,change bags,linking rings,etc)
This is the area to discuss creativity,theory,and psychology in our magic
News and views on conventions, lectures, club meetings, etc.
Discussion on performing magic with rings, strings, dice, rubberbands, pencils, paddles, etc.
Discussions on magic that uses sleight of hand skills, such as Cups & Balls, Sponge Balls, the Chop Cup and so on.
This area is for those interested in building their own props

sub_forum_name: Dvd, Video tape, Audio tape & Compact discs.
description: This area for reviews of dvds, video tapes, audio tapes or compact discs exclusively.
This area for reviews of books, pamphlets and notes only.

Discussions on working cruise ships, & doing trade shows. Topics may also include routine ideas for motivational magic & other specialized programs. This is also the area to talk about the business side of magic (e.g, contracts, promotions, taxes, etc)

Forum for posts focusing on user-submitted videos or images. All media content should be appropriate for all audiences and must not contain any copyrighted intellectual property without the permission of the respective copyright holder. In addition, absolutely no exposure videos will be allowed - no exceptions.
General discussion on working restaurants and bars, as well as doing strolling magic
If you are a beginner, here is the place to seek advice and ask questions.
General discussion on large illusions.
Topics on the challenging art of performing for children, including birthday shows,school programs, and magic with a special message.
Here is a place for new members to introduce themselves to the rest of our community.

If performing sleight of hand magic with coins has you excited, this is your forum! Topics may include effects like Matrix, Coins across, Misers Dream, etc. This is also the area to discuss Okito box work.
If graveside magic is your thing...
This area for reviews of magic tricks only.

This forum provided as a place where folks can discuss the latest rumors, read announcements and speculate about the obvious hyperbole surrounding many of the upcoming products that are released into magicdom. Will they be genuine miracles or mere rhetoric? We ponder the question...
A place to discuss things which have nothing to do with magic
General discussion of mentalism.
Serious discussions surrounding tricks and effects which use pure skill and sleight of hand. Lovers of the pasteboards unite!
